pages.text: Arizonasaurus babbitti is a species of Poposauroid reptile from the middle Triassic of the United States. Originally described on a few teeth and a piece of the upper jaw in 1947, it took until 2002 for researchers to describe a more complete specimen of the animal.

Perhaps most curious for the rounded sail on top of its back, supported by the long neural spines, this animal is most closely related with Ctenosauriscus, forming a family with it and other closely related animals.
Other relatives of this animal, although further removed, are Poposaurus, Sillosuchus and Lotosaurus.
